comments:
While using 3.1.M5a normally to develop Java code, a large amount of errors are
generated and the Workbench is often only useable after restarting. This is one
such error generated. It is hard for me to give more specific information (I do
not know exactly what caused it.)

Since #openInputFile and #openExtraFile can both fail and allow execution to
continue (error is logged rather than thrown), then all read accesses to those
fields need to be first checked against null.

Pascal, let me know if you want me to release code changes while you are away.
DJ, I would appreciate your help even though I'm here.

Are you setting any system properties (on the command line or in the 
config.ini) or any other command line args?

Pascal and I talked about this a bit.

In this case, the extension registry is now invalid so we need a way to tell the
system to re-build it. Unfortuanatly we can't do this on the fly because clients
are holding onto handles which would now be invalid.

What we really want to do is tell the system to re-build the registry on the
next startup. Perhaps we should remove the file entry from the file manager,
shut down the system, and then on next start we would look for the file, not
find it, and then re-build.

Created an attachment (id=19116)
patch for org.eclipse.core.runtime

Pascal, please review this patch and see if its good. 

The intention is if we have a problem with the registry files, then we force
the registry to be re-calculated on next startup.

traces.message: c:\dev\eclipse\configuration\org.eclipse.core.runtime\.mainData.42 (The system cannot find the file specified)
